wp:term.wp:term_description: Learn how to publish your own content
Change various aspects of this theme
Various tips and tricks for Lore theme
Learn how to install and configure Lore theme
Enrich your pages with small code snippets

Nullam quis ante. Etiam sit amet orci eget eros faucibus tincidunt

item.title: Introduction
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: As you might already noticed, this demo site also acts as the documentation for the Lore theme. We thought this is a great way how to show this theme in a very realistic scenario (there are still few dummy "Lorem Ipsum" post though). Please note, that this documentation doesn't cover WordPress basics too extensively, so if you are new to WordPress, we highly recommend you to read through some beginner tutorials first. [lore_alert_message type="info"] Please check out the recommended server requirements for the WordPress installation and Lore theme itself. PHP 5.4 is absolute minimum [/lore_alert_message] [lore_alert_message type="info"] Besides the recommended server requirements for WordPress, make sure your PHP memory for WordPress is set to at least 64MB. However, if you are going to use several 3rd party plugins, we recommend 128MB. You can read more about changing the PHP memmory in WordPress codex [/lore_alert_message] If you are already loving Lore theme, please don't forget to rate it 5 stars under your downloads section of your ThemeForest profile.  Thank you!
item.excerpt:encoded: A quick introduction to the Lore theme with some basic requirements

item.title: Theme Installation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Once you've successfully installed WordPress, let's proceed to the installation of the theme itself.

1. Downloading The Package

If you haven't already, download the full package from your downloads on ThemeForest [caption id="attachment_8" align="alignnone" width="700"] 1. Click on Download button next to purchased item
2. Choose All files & documentation and download the zip file[/caption] [caption id="attachment_12" align="alignnone" width="700"] 1. Enable email notifications if you want to be informed when the new update is available
2. If you like the theme, don't forget to rate it 5* please. Thank you![/caption] When you unzip the downloaded file, you will see bunch of folders. The most important one is the THEME folder which contains the installable theme .ZIP. [caption id="attachment_17" align="alignnone" width="135"] 1. THEME folder contains the installable theme .ZIP[/caption]

2. Theme Installation

Open your WordPress admin and navigate to Appearance / Themes [caption id="attachment_18" align="alignnone" width="320"] 1. You can manage themes under Appearance / Themes[/caption] Upload the installable theme .ZIP file [caption id="attachment_19" align="alignnone" width="1241"] 1. Click on Add New button
2. Click on Upload Theme button
3. Choose theme .ZIP file
4. Submit the file[/caption] [lore_alert_message type="info"] If you have problems installing your theme via admin (as described above), you can try to install it via FTP [/lore_alert_message]

3. Child Theme Installation

If you don't know what a WordPress child theme is, please read this article in WordPress codex. This documentation assume that you are running the child theme, so it is highly recommended to install it. Child theme .ZIP can be found in Child Theme folder. Install it in exactly the same way as parent theme, described in previous steps. Once you have both parent and child themes installed, you need to activate the child one. [lore_alert_message type="info"] It is recommended to set your Settings / Permalinks to "Post name". Also, every time you are experiencing strange 404 error, re-save those settings. [/lore_alert_message] Please continue to the next chapter where you will learn how to install the required plugins to access all features this themes has to offer.
item.excerpt:encoded: Learn how to install the Lore theme and its child theme

item.title: Plugins Installation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Once you've activated the theme, you should see a prompt message at the top of your admin informing you about required plugins. [caption id="attachment_91" align="alignnone" width="757"] 1. Click on Begin installing plugins[/caption] [caption id="attachment_92" align="alignnone" width="587"] 1. Select all plugins
2. Choose Install
3. Hit Apply[/caption] [caption id="attachment_93" align="alignnone" width="574"] 1. Wait for plugins to be installed and then click on Return to Required Plugins installer[/caption] [caption id="attachment_94" align="alignnone" width="471"] 1. Select all plugins
2. Choose Activate
3. Hit Apply[/caption] That's it. Required plugins should be now installed and activated. Here is the list of required plugins if you are unable to see the prompt (for example if you've accidentally dismissed it):

Lore Theme Toolkit

This plugin contains lots of theme's features, like custom post types, shortcodes and widgets. The plugin .zip can be found in full package in Plugins folder if you need to install it manually

Kirki

Adds theme options into Customizer.

Recommended and Handy Plugins

Check out the list of recommended plugins which are used on the demo site and list of various handy plugins you may find useful for your project.
item.excerpt:encoded: Plugins are the real power of WordPress! Learn how to install the most important ones

item.title: Demo Data Import
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Demo data are distributed via a separate file (lore-demo.xml), which can be found in theme's full package (read the Theme Installation chapter to learn how to download the full package) in Demo Data folder. To import the demo data, navigate to Tools / Import and click on WordPress. You may be prompted to install the Importer plugin if you don't have it already. After you install and activate it, go again to Tools / Import / WordPress, choose lore-demo.xml file from Demo Data folder in full package and submit it. [lore_alert_message type="info"] Please note that demo import won't make your site immediately look like the demo! There are additional steps required, like choosing your front page under Settings / Reading, menus under Appearance / Menus and sidebars under Appearance / Widgets. There is a separate article about setting up your front page. Follow the rest of documentation please [/lore_alert_message] [lore_alert_message type="info"] Demo XML does not contain some data which rely on 3rd party plugins, like for example file attachments and forum posts. bbPress dummy data can be downloaded separately. Check out recommended plugins article to see which 3rd party plugins were used in the demo [/lore_alert_message] [lore_alert_message type="info"] Demo images are not part of the demo import (placeholder image will be imported instead). You can find a lot of nice free images for your site at unsplash.com [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: How to import bundled .xml file with demo content

item.title: Knowledge Base
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Knowledge Base is a bread and butter of this theme. Working with Knowledge base articles is very similar to working with regular posts. Each article can be assigned to a category and can include several tags. You can manage your Knowledge Base articles under Knowledge Base section of admin. To set category icon, use Category Icon field when creating or editing a category. Read this article to learn more about using icons. By default, your Knowledge Base page is accessible on yoursite.com/knowledge-base URL (make sure to set your Settings / Permalinks to Post name). You can change the knowledge-base slug of the URL under Appearance / Customize / Knowledge Base. Don't forget to resave Settings / Permalinks after you change slugs. You can use [[lore_kb_articles]] shortcode to insert Knowledge Base articles list to any page. There are also bunch of Knowledge Base specific widgets (Lore Knowledge Base Articles and Lore Knowledge Base Categories) you can assign to any sidebar under Appearance / Widgets. [lore_alert_message type="info"] Make sure to review all options under Appearance / Customize / Knowledge Base (and all options under Appearance / Customize in general), to familiarise yourself with the theme. [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: Bread and butter of this theme. Learn how to manage your knowledge base

item.title: Customizer
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This theme fully supports default WordPress Customizer (with help from Kirki plugin). You can access it via Appearance / Customize, where you can edit almost every aspect of the theme like menus, sidebars and widgets, header logo and much, much more. [caption id="attachment_421" align="alignnone" width="913"] Customizer screenshot[/caption] [lore_alert_message type="info"] When you are trying to edit widgets via Customizer, only sidebars visible on your current page are available. Go to Appearance / Widgets to manage all sidebars in one place [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: This theme fully supports default WordPress Customizer

item.title: Standard Blog Posts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Before you start adding your blog (news) posts, go to Settings / Reading and set your Posts page. [caption id="attachment_115" align="alignnone" width="940"] 1. Select A static page
2. Choose your Front page
3. Choose your Posts page[/caption] Since the blog posts are the core WordPress feature, you can read more about them in WordPress Codex. [lore_alert_message type="info"] Theme-specific settings for post pages can be found under Appearance / Customize / Standard Posts (blog) [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: Standard posts are the core feature of WordPress

item.title: Shortcode Generator
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Shortcodes are small pieces of code which can be used to include various elements into content of your site. This theme offers several custom shortcodes, which can be inserted very easily via Shortcode Generator. [caption id="attachment_122" align="alignnone" width="784"] 1. Click on Add Shortcode button
2. Choose shortcode from the list
3. Customize its parameters
4. You can copy the generated code to clipboard
5. Insert shortcode into content[/caption] [lore_alert_message type="info"] Only theme's custom shortcodes are available in Shortcode Generator [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: Shortcodes are small pieces of code which can be used to include various elements into content of your site

item.title: Accordion
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_accordion type="default"] [lore_accordion_item title="First Accordion Tab" state="closed"] Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts [/lore_accordion_item] [lore_accordion_item title="Second Accordion Tab" state="closed"] Separated they live in Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean [/lore_accordion_item] [lore_accordion_item title="Third Accordion Tab" state="closed"] A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia [/lore_accordion_item] [/lore_accordion]

Code

[[lore_accordion type="default"]
[lore_accordion_item title="First Accordion Tab" state="closed"]
Lorem ipsum
[/lore_accordion_item]
[lore_accordion_item title="Second Accordion Tab" state="closed"]
Lorem ipsum
[/lore_accordion_item]
[/lore_accordion]]
Accordion shortcode consists of two separate shortcodes. [[lore_accordion]] is used as a container for one or more [[lore_accordion_item]] shortcodes.

Parameters

[[lore_accordion]] type - default or toggle. When set to toggle, other accordion items won't be automatically collapsed after opening new ones custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling [[lore_accordion_item]] title - text title of accordion item state - closed or open. Set the default state of this particular accordion item custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Alert Message
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_alert_message type="info"] Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts [/lore_alert_message] [lore_alert_message type="warning"] Separated they live in Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean [/lore_alert_message] [lore_alert_message type="success"] A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia [/lore_alert_message]

Code

[[lore_alert_message type="success"]
Lorem ipsum
[/lore_alert_message]]

Parameters

type - info, warning or success custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Is bbPress plugin supported?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Yes, theme was tested with bbPress plugin. You can read more about its integration in Knowledge Base.

item.title: Is it possible to add more icons?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The easiest way to do it is to install one of many 3rd party plugins for that.

item.title: I've imported the demo content, but my site doesn't look like the demo
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Importing the demo .xml file is only a first step when achieving a demo look. You have to set up your menus under Appearance / Menus, edit widgets and sidebars under Appearance / Widgets and set up your front page and blog page. Probably the most important step is to set the demo front page (page with title Knowledge Base. Elegant. Lightweight. WordPress Based.) as your site's front page. It can be done under Settings / Reading. Then you can fine tune it under Appearance / Customize / Default Front Page Settings. There is a separate article about the front page. You should definitely read it.

item.title: How to install WordPress?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Please read the official tutorial on WordPress Codex

item.title: Is plugin X supported?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This theme was built with best WordPress practices in mind, which means that generally any 3rd party plugin should work. But since there are thousands and thousands of plugins in official plugin repository (and other thousands of premium plugins on various marketplaces), it is not possible to make sure it really does work with every plugin out there.

item.title: How to manage post attachments?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: You can use free Attachments plugin for that

item.title: How to set header background?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: You can set global header background image under Appearance / Customize / Header Settings with Background Image option. You can override this image for Knowledge Base pages under Appearance / Customize/ Knowledge Base with Background Image option and for FAQ pages under Appearance / Customize/ FAQ  with Background Image option. Also, if you set up a featured image for a regular page, it will be used as a header background for that specific page.

item.title: How do I change Knowledge Base category icon?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Edit or add category under Knowledge Base / Categories and insert icon name (for example "loreico loreico-heart", without quotes) into Category Icon field.

item.title: Blog List
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_blog_list title="Recent Blog Posts" limit="2" columns="2" more_btn_label="More Posts"]

Code

[[lore_blog_list title="Recent Blog Posts" limit="2" columns="2" more_btn_label="More Posts"]]

Parameters

title - title which will be displayed above this element limit - numerical. Set the number of posts to display. Set to 0 to display al posts columns - numerical from 1 to 3. Number of columns (posts per row) more_btn_label - text of the button at bottom, which opens default posts archive page. Leave blank to hide this button custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Button
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_button label="Small Button" link="#" size="small" style="default"] [lore_button label="Regular Button" link="#" size="regular" style="default"] [lore_button label="Large Button" link="#" size="large" style="default"] [lore_separator style="transparent" size="small"] [lore_button label="Small Button" link="#" size="small" style="outline"] [lore_button label="Regular Button" link="#" size="regular" style="outline"] [lore_button label="Large Button" link="#" size="large" style="outline"]  

Code

[[lore_button label="Small Button" link="#" size="small" style="outline"]]

Parameters

label - text label of the button link - absolute URL where the button will link (starting with http:// or https:// respectively) size - small, regular or large style - default or outline custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Content Grid
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_content_grid columns="2" masonry="yes"]

Description

Display widgets from Content Grid sidebar (you can populate it under Appearance / Widgets). Optionally, you can choose to display widgets from one of the custom sidebars.

Code

[[lore_content_grid sidebar="lsvr-lore-content-grid-sidebar" columns="2" masonry="yes" title="My Widgets" more_btn_label="Learn more" more_btn_link="http://example.com"]]

Parameters

title - leave blank to hide title sidebar - numerical sidebar ID. Leave blank to use Content Grid sidebar or set to lsvr-lore-custom-sidebar-x, where x is the number of Custom Sidebar columns - numerical 1 to 4. Items per row masonry - yes or no. Enable or disable masonry layout more_btn_label - text of a button linked to a custom URL. Leave blank to hide this button more_btn_link - absolute URL of button custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Contents
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Description

Create table of contents with anchor links to all heading elements (h1, h2, h3...) with ID attribute. For example <h2 id="unique-id">Heading</h2>. You have to switch to Text mode to add ID attribute.

Code

[[lore_contents title="Contents"]]

Parameters

title - title which will be displayed above element. Leave blank to hide excluded_ids - elements with these IDs will be ignored. Separate with comma custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: FAQ List
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_faq title="FAQ" limit="3" default_state="closed" enable_permalink="no"]

Description

List of FAQ posts. You can manage them under FAQ section of the admin.

Code

[[lore_faq title="FAQ" limit="3" default_state="closed" enable_permalink="no"]]

Parameters

title - text to display above list category - category ID. Category to load FAQ posts from. Set to 0 to load FAQ posts regardless of category post_list - post ID or slug. Display only specific FAQ posts. Insert IDs or slugs of those posts separated by comma. For example: my-post-1,my-post-2. Category field will be ignored limit - numerical. Number of FAQ posts. Set to 0 to load all posts default_state - closed or open. Default state of accordion items enable_permalink - yes or no. Show individual permalink or each FAQ post more_btn_label - text label for button which links to default FAQ posts archive page custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Separator
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_separator style="default" size="medium"]

Code

[[lore_separator style="default" size="medium"]]

Parameters

style - default or transparent. Style of the separator line size - small, medium or large. Size of top and bottom margins custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Tabs
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_tabs] [lore_tab_item title="First Tab"] Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts [/lore_tab_item] [lore_tab_item title="Second Tab"] Separated they live in Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean [/lore_tab_item] [lore_tab_item title="Third Tab"] A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia [/lore_tab_item] [/lore_tabs]

Code

[[lore_tabs]
[lore_tab_item title="First Tab"]
Lorem ipsum
[/lore_tab_item]
[lore_tab_item title="Second Tab"]
Lorem ipsum
[/lore_tab_item]
[/lore_tabs]]
Tabs shortcode consists of two separate shortcodes. [[lore_tabs]] is used as a container for one or more [[lore_tab_item]] shortcodes.

Parameters

[[lore_tabs]] custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling [[lore_tab_item]] title - text title of tab item custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Forum (bbPress)
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This theme supports bbPress plugin, which is the most popular solution for a WordPress based forum. Support comes in a form of custom CSS styling for bbPress pages and small code tweaks for seamless integration. Also, there is a pre-defined page template for bbPress Login/Registration. Just create a regular page and set its Template (under Page Attributes) to bbPress Login / Register. bbPress has its own extensive documentation which should get you started.
item.excerpt:encoded: This theme supports bbPress plugin, which is the most popular solution for a WordPress based forum

item.title: Video Article
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GpX7dVetp1o
Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean.

item.title: Audio Article
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
https://soundcloud.com/solarfields/solar-fields-jupiter-sessions
A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth. Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar.
item.excerpt:encoded: A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia

item.title: Image Article
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The Big Oxmox advised her not to do so, because there were thousands of bad Commas, wild Question Marks and devious Semikoli, but the Little Blind Text didn’t listen.
item.excerpt:encoded: The Big Oxmox advised her not to do so, because there were thousands of bad Commas

item.title: Front Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
There are multiple ways how to create a front page. If you want to build your custom one, without any attachments to the demo front page, then just create a regular page, fill it with the content and set it under Settings / Reading as your Front page. Don't forget you can use Shortcode Generator if you want to use theme's built-in shortcodes. But what if you want to use the same or similar front page as you can see in the demo? Let's follow next steps to learn how to do it.

Create a Regular Page

If you've imported the demo content you can skip this step as you already have this page (it's called Knowledge Base. Elegant. Lightweight. WordPress Based.). For those who are building their site from the scratch, go to Pages and create a new page with page template set to Default Front Page. [caption id="attachment_388" align="alignnone" width="1038"] 1. Create a new page
2. Insert a title which will be displayed at the top of the page
3. Content will be displayed under pre-defined layout of Default Front Page template (we will get to that in a moment)
4. Set page template to Default Front Page
5. You can override global header background image with page's Featured image
6. Save the page[/caption]

Set Your Page as a Front Page

Go to Settings / Reading and set the page from previous step as Front page. [caption id="attachment_115" align="alignnone" width="940"] 1. Select A static page
2. Choose your Front page
3. Choose your Posts page[/caption]

Configure Your Front Page

You can configure your front page under Appearance / Customize / Default Front Page Settings (those settings will work only if your front page uses Default Front Page template as described in one of previous steps). All options there should be self-explanatory via their description.
item.excerpt:encoded: There are multiple ways how to create a front page

item.title: Dummy Article
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Curabitur ullamcorper ultricies nisi. Nam eget dui. Etiam rhoncus. Maecenas tempus, tellus eget condimentum rhoncus, sem quam semper libero, sit amet adipiscing sem neque sed ipsum. Nam quam nunc, blandit vel, luctus pulvinar, hendrerit id, lorem. Maecenas nec odio et ante tincidunt tempus. Donec vitae sapien ut libero venenatis faucibus
item.excerpt:encoded: Curabitur ullamcorper ultricies nisi. Nam eget dui. Etiam rhoncus. Maecenas tempus, tellus eget condimentum rhoncus, sem quam semper libero

item.title: Another Dummy Text
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Donec vitae sapien ut libero venenatis faucibus. Nullam quis ante. Etiam sit amet orci eget eros faucibus tincidunt. Duis leo. Sed fringilla mauris sit amet nibh. Donec sodales sagittis magna. Sed consequat, leo eget bibendum sodales, augue velit cursus nunc
item.excerpt:encoded: Donec vitae sapien ut libero venenatis faucibus. Nullam quis ante. Etiam sit amet orci eget eros faucibus tincidunt

item.title: Lorem Ipsum Title
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Aliquam lorem ante, dapibus in, viverra quis, feugiat a, tellus. Phasellus viverra nulla ut metus varius laoreet. Quisque rutrum. Aenean imperdiet. Etiam ultricies nisi vel augue. Curabitur ullamcorper ultricies nisi. Nam eget dui. Etiam rhoncus. Maecenas tempus, tellus eget condimentum rhoncus, sem quam semper libero
item.excerpt:encoded: Aliquam lorem ante, dapibus in, viverra quis, feugiat a, tellus. Phasellus viverra nulla ut metus varius laoreet

item.title: Icons
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This theme comes with two custom icon font families. They contains icons handpicked from FontAwesome and Nova Icons sets. List of bundled FontAwesome Icons List of bundled Nova Icons (Loreicons) There are multiple fields across the theme where you can insert the icon name. To do so, prefix the icon's name from the list with additional "fa" (for FontAwesome icons) or "loreico" (for Nova icons) respectively. For example "fa fa-check" or "loreico loreico-heart" (without quotes). [lore_alert_message type="info"] Please note that only limited number of FontAwesome icons are bundled with the theme. If you want to use full set, you can use a 3rd party plugin like Better Font Awesome. Then you can disable bundled FontAwesome icon set under Appearance / Customize / Misc Settings with with Load Bundled FontAwesome Icons option to save bandwith. [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: This theme comes with custom icon font family which contains icons handpicked from several icon libraries

item.title: FAQ
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Same as for Knowledge Base articles, working with FAQ posts is very similar to working with regular posts. You can put them to categories and assign them tags. FAQ posts can be managed under FAQ section of admin. By default, your FAQ archive page is accessible on yoursite.com/faq URL (make sure to set your Settings / Permalinks to Post name). You can change the faq slug of the URL under Appearance / Customize / FAQ. Don't forget to resave Settings / Permalinks after you change slugs. You can use [[lore_faq]] shortcode to insert FAQ list to any page. There are also bunch of FAQ specific widgets (Lore FAQ Posts and Lore FAQ Categories) you can assign to any sidebar under Appearance / Widgets. [lore_alert_message type="info"] Make sure to review all options under Appearance / Customize / FAQ (and all options under Appearance / Customize in general), to familiarise yourself with the theme. [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: Put your frequently asked questions into separate posts for easier management

item.title: Knowledge Base Articles
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_kb_articles category="0" title="Knowledge Base" order="default" limit="5" show_icon="yes" show_date="yes" show_rating="yes" show_excerpt="yes"]

Description

List of Knowledge Base articles. You can manage them under Knowledge Base section of the admin.

Code

[[lore_kb_articles category="0" title="Knowledge Base" order="default" limit="5" show_icon="yes" show_date="yes" show_rating="yes" show_excerpt="yes"]]

Parameters

title - text to display above list category - category ID. Category to load articles from. Set to 0 to load articles regardless of category order - default, recent or popular. Order of articles limit - numerical. Number of articles to show. Set to 0 to load all articles show_icon - yes or no. Show article icons show_date - yes or no. Show article date show_rating - yes or no. Show article rating show_excerpt - yes or no. Show article excerpt. You can learn how to set excerpt here more_btn_label - text label for button which links to default Knowledge Base archive page custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Excerpt
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
You can set an excerpt for regular posts, Knowledge Base articles and FAQ posts. This text will be used in listing pages, widgets and shortcodes where applicable. To define an excerpt, first make sure you have it enabled. To do so, click on Screen Options in upper right corner of post edit screen and check Excerpt. [caption id="attachment_348" align="alignnone" width="1062"] 1. Click on Screen Options
2. Check Excerpt[/caption] Then scroll down and you should see an Excerpt field. [caption id="attachment_349" align="alignnone" width="831"] 1. Put your excerpt here[/caption]
item.excerpt:encoded: Learn how to set excerpt text for posts. Like this one

item.title: Color Scheme
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
There are multiple ways how to change colors of this theme. Color schemes can be managed under Appearance / Customize / Color Scheme.

Predefined Color Scheme

Choose one of predefined color schemes.

Pick Colors

Here you can pick link and accent colors and the color scheme will be generated automatically based on those two colors.

Paste Generated CSS

  1. Open default color scheme .scss file. It should open directly in your browser, but some browsers may download it on your disk instead.
  2. Copy all the code from that link to any text editor. If your browser downloaded your file, open that file in the text editor. You can use for example Notepad++ for Windows or Brackets for Mac.
  3. Make your changes. Basically you just need to change color variables at the top of the file. Most prominent is the $accent variable on line 27. By default, it looks like this: 
    $accent: #74aa7b; // main accent color
    There are many online tools where you can generate a hex code for your color, for example colorpicker.com.  Just change #74aa7b to hex code of your custom color (don't forget that it has to start with # sign). Feel free to change values of other color variables in the file as well.
  4. Copy your changed code and paste it to the left column on sassmeister.com (SCSS).  Please note that any typo in your syntax may lead into an error when generating your CSS code. So double check code in your file when there is any issue converting your SASS into CSS.
  5. Copy generated code from right column (CSS)
  6. Paste this generated code under Appearance / Customize into Generated CSS field (Color Scheme Source has to be set to Paste Generated CSS for this field to be visible).

Load From Child Theme

Follow the steps as described above (in Paste Generated CSS), but there is a change in the last step. Instead of pasting your code in Customizer, paste it into child theme style.css. You can access this file either via FTP, or directly in admin under Appearance / Editor.
item.excerpt:encoded: There are multiple ways how to change colors of this theme

item.title: Sidebars & Widgets
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Sidebars and widgets can be managed under Appearance / Widgets. Lore comes with bunch of custom widgets (their name is prefixed with "Lore") and several sidebars. Please read the description of each sidebar to learn more about it.

Custom Sidebars

Lore offers several custom sidebars. You can change their number under Appearance / Customize / Misc Settings with Number of Custom Sidebars option. Custom sidebars can be assigned to regular pages with Sidebar on the Left or Sidebar on the Right page templates. [caption id="attachment_425" align="alignnone" width="572"] 1. Choose Sidebar on the Left or Sidebar on the Right template
2. Choose which sidebar should be used[/caption]
item.excerpt:encoded: Sidebars and widgets can be managed under Appearance / Widgets

item.title: Recommended Plugins
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The following plugins are not required, but they add some cool features to the theme. All of these plugins were used in the demo site.

[lore_alert_message type="info"] Just a small advice: do not install plugins you won't use. Again, they are not required, so there is no point in bloating your WordPress installation with unnecessary functionality. You can install them anytime later. [/lore_alert_message]

Attachments

Adds option to attach files to Knowledge Base posts

bbPress

The most popular forum plugin for WordPress

Contact Form 7

The most popular plugin for creating contact forms

Intuitive Custom Post Order

Great tool for ordering your posts or categories

Wordfence

Protection from hacks and malware

WP Super Cache

Caching plugin to speed up loading of your site [lore_alert_message type="info"] 3rd party plugins can be installed under Plugins / Add New - type plugin's name in the search box. [/lore_alert_message]
item.excerpt:encoded: The following plugins are not required, but they add some cool features to the theme

item.title: Handy Plugins
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Here is the list of plugins which weren't used in the demo, but they can still be very useful in some situations.

Better Font Awesome

This theme contains only handpicked FontAwesome icons (along icons from other libraries). This plugin will add a full set of Font Awesome icons to your site. Don't forget to disable loading of bundled FontAwesome set under Appearance / Customize / Misc Settings with Load Bundled FontAwesome Icons option to save bandwith

Loco Translate

Free plugin for translating the theme and plugins to your language

MailChimp for WordPress

Mailchimp subscribe form

TablePress

Great plugin for creating tables

W3 Total Cache

Alternative caching plugin. Do not use more than one caching plugin at the same time!

WPML

The most popular plugin for translating the theme and making multi-language sites. It is not free though
item.excerpt:encoded: Here is the list of plugins which weren't used in the demo, but they can still be very useful in some situations

item.title: How to Install Plugins
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: There are many places where you can download WordPress plugins, but the most popular one is definitely official Wordpress plugins repository. Here you can browse thousands of plugins and interact with their authors via separate forums. But how do you install them? The most easiest way is to do it via your site's admin. Navigate to Plugins / Add New and type plugin's name in the search box. There are alternative way to install plugins, you can learn more about it in WordPress Codex.
item.excerpt:encoded: There are many places where you can download WordPress plugins

item.title: Theme Translation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The easiest way to translate the theme is to use Loco Translate plugin. Remember that you have to translate both Lore theme and Lore Theme Toolkit plugin. If you are using the child theme (which you definitely should!), Loco translate will give you an option to create your language file for both parent (Lore) and child (Lore Child) themes. Ignore the Lore theme and create it for Lore Child theme only, so you won't lose your translations after you update the theme in the future. If you want to run your site in multiple languages, you can use WPML plugin for that (it is not free though). There is also an old-fashioned way to create your translation via Poedit app. You will find the source lore.pot file in theme's languages folder.
item.excerpt:encoded: The easiest way to translate the theme is to use Loco Translate plugin

item.title: Updating the Theme
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: To update the theme, simply download it again from your downloads on ThemeForest (download just Installable WordPress file only). Latest version will be downloaded. Then deactivate and remove your current version of parent theme (you may need to activate another theme to be able to see an option for deleting your current theme) and install the downloaded version. You won't lose your changes you made in admin. Alternatively, you can update the theme by overwriting the Lore folder in wp-content/themes via FTP. You should update the parent theme (Lore) only. There is no need for updating the child theme (Lore Child).
item.excerpt:encoded: To update the theme, simply download it again from your downloads on ThemeForest

item.title: Feature
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:

For example set to 6 for half size, 4 for third size etc. offset - 0 to 11. Left margin of this column custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Google Map
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[lore_gmap apikey="PUT-YOUR-GOOGLE-API-KEY-HERE" address="106 S 9th StBrooklyn, NY 11249" type="satellite" zoom="18" height="360"]

Code

[[lore_gmap apikey="PUT-YOUR-GOOGLE-API-KEY-HERE" address="106 S 9th StBrooklyn, NY 11249" type="satellite" zoom="18" height="360"]]

Parameters

apikey - Google API key. This key is required for map to work. Get your key here address - for example: 8833 Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90069, USA latitude - optional, it can be more precise than using just the address. For example: 40.724741 longitude - optional, it can be more precise than using just the address. For example: -73.994797 type - roadmap | satellite | terrain | hybrid zoom - 16 | 17 | 18 | 19 but you can try to experiment with other values as well height - height of the map in pixels fullwidth - yes | no, stretch the map to full width of content custom_class - add a custom CSS class for this element which you can use for custom styling

item.title: Contact Form
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Contact Form 7 is the recommended plugin for contact form functionality. Please check out its official site if you need any help on how to use this plugin. The following code is the form template used in the demo. Insert it under Contact / <your-contact-form> / Form if you want to make your own form look like the one in the demo. 
[response]
<div class="row">
<div class="col-md-6">
<label>[text your-subject placeholder "Subject"]</label>
<label>[text* your-name placeholder "Your Name (required)"]</label>
<label>[email* your-email placeholder "Your Email (required)"]</label>
</div>
<div class="col-md-6">
<label>[textarea your-message x7 placeholder "Your Message"]</label>
</div>
</div>
<div class="text-align-center">[submit class:c-button "Send Message"]</div>

item.title: News
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This page is used to display your blog posts. Don't forget to set it under Settings / Reading as your Posts page.
Title of this page will be used as a title for default blog archive.
This text won't be displayed anywhere.

item.title: What Is WordPress
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system (CMS) based on PHP and MySQL. WordPress is installed on a web server, which either is part of an Internet hosting service or is a network host itself; the first case may be on a service like WordPress.com, for example, and the second case is a computer running the software package WordPress.org. An example of the second case is a local computer configured to act as its own web server hosting WordPress for single-user testing or learning purposes. Features include a plugin architecture and a template system. WordPress was used by more than 26.4% of the top 10 million websites as of April 2016. WordPress is the most popular blogging system in use on the Web, at more than 60 million websites. It was released on May 27, 2003, by its founders, Matt Mullenweg and Mike Little, as a fork of b2/cafelog. The license under which WordPress software is released is the GPLv2 (or later) from the Free Software Foundation. This article uses material from the Wikipedia article WordPress, which is released under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share-Alike License 3.0.
item.excerpt:encoded: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system (CMS) based on PHP and MySQL. It was released on May 27, 2003

item.title: Themes And Plugins
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Themes

WordPress users may install and switch between themes. Themes allow users to change the look and functionality of a WordPress website and they can be installed without altering the content or health of the site. Every WordPress website requires at least one theme to be present and every theme should be designed using WordPress standards with structured PHP, valid HTML and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS). Themes may be directly installed using the WordPress "Appearance" administration tool in the dashboard or theme folders may be uploaded via FTP. The PHP, HTML (HyperText Markup Language) and CSS code found in themes can be added to or edited for providing advanced features. WordPress themes are in general classified into two categories, free themes and premium themes. All the free themes are listed in the WordPress theme directory and premium themes should be purchased from marketplaces and individual WordPress developers. WordPress users may also create and develop their own custom themes if they have the knowledge and skill to do so. If WordPress users do not have themes development knowledge then they may download and use free WordPress themes from wordpress.org.

Plugins

WordPress's plugin architecture allows users to extend the features and functionality of a website or blog. WordPress has over 40,501 plugins available, each of which offers custom functions and features enabling users to tailor their sites to their specific needs. These customizations range from search engine optimization, to client portals used to display private information to logged in users, to content management systems, to content displaying features, such as the addition of widgets and navigation bars. But not all available plugins are always abreast with the upgrades and as a result they may not function properly or may not function at all. This article uses material from the Wikipedia article WordPress, which is released under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share-Alike License 3.0.
item.excerpt:encoded: Themes allow users to change the look and functionality of a WordPress website and they can be installed without altering the content

item.title: What is Knowledge Base
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: A knowledge base (KB) is a technology used to store complex structured and unstructured information used by a computer system. The initial use of the term was in connection with expert systems which were the first knowledge-based systems.The original use of the term knowledge-base was to describe one of the two sub-systems of a knowledge-based system. A knowledge-based system consists of a knowledge-base that represents facts about the world and an inference engine that can reason about those facts and use rules and other forms of logic to deduce new facts or highlight inconsistencies. The term "knowledge-base" was coined to distinguish this form of knowledge store from the more common and widely-used term database. At the time (the 1970s) virtually all large Management Information Systems stored their data in some type of hierarchical or relational database. At this point in the history of Information Technology the distinction between a database and a knowledge base was clear and unambiguous. This article uses material from the Wikipedia article Knowledge Base, which is released under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share-Alike License 3.0.
item.excerpt:encoded: A knowledge base is a technology used to store complex structured and unstructured information used by a computer system

item.title: Typography
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Heading 1

Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia.

Heading 2

It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth. Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar.

Heading 3

The Big Oxmox advised her not to do so, because there were thousands of bad Commas, wild Question Marks and devious Semikoli, but the Little Blind Text didn’t listen.

Heading 4

She packed her seven versalia, put her initial into the belt and made herself on the way.
Heading 5
When she reached the first hills of the Italic Mountains, she had a last view back on the skyline of her hometown Bookmarksgrove, the headline of Alphabet Village and the subline of her own road, the Line Lane.
Heading 6
Pityful a rethoric question ran over her cheek, then she continued her way. On her way she met a copy.
The copy warned the Little Blind Text, that where it came from it would have been rewritten a thousand times and everything that was left from its origin would be the word "and" and the Little Blind Text should turn around and return to its own
